newsitem.title: CANADA: Corel sees Q3 loss from delayed shipments.
newsitem.headline: Corel sees Q3 loss from delayed shipments.

text.p: Corel Corp said on Monday that it will likely post a third-quarter loss of US$0.05 to US$0.07 a share after experiencing delays in shipping its software suite, called Office Professional 7.
The loss will be incurred despite a gain of about US$0.10 a share from the sale of its CD Creator product line to Adaptec Inc.
Corel, Canada's largest software company, said the amount of product ordered but not shipped and therefore not included in the revenue for the quarter was about US$15 million.

Corel president Michael Cowpland said in a statement: "These difficulties are attributable to our continuing integration of the new products acquired by the company and all our systems and programs are under ongoing review to address and correct any deficiencies in these areas."
The company said it remained optimistic about the sale of Corel WordPerfect.
